event.title: were relocated from an address in downtown Ceres in 2012

data.event: The offices of the Ceres Courier were relocated from an address in downtown Ceres in 2012.
It has since combined day-to-day operations with its sister paper, The Turlock Journal, in Turlock, CA . Jeff Benziger was appointed Editor in 1987.

event.title: brings the Ceres Street Faire on the first weekend

data.event: Spring brings the Ceres Street Faire on the first weekend in May.
Halloween Fun Festival marks the Fall followed by the colorful, and much-attended, Christmas Tree Lane opening ceremony.

event.title: followed by the colorful, and much-attended, Christmas

data.event: Halloween Fun Festival marks the Fall followed by the colorful, and much-attended, Christmas Tree Lane opening ceremony.

event.title: inhabited Ceres were those of John Service, Cassius Warner, and Daniel Whitmore in the year 1867

data.event: The first non-native families that inhabited Ceres were those of John Service, Cassius Warner, and Daniel Whitmore in the year 1867.
He built his home in 1870, the Whitmore Mansion at 2928 5th Street.
